intro: Erigeron poliospermus var. disciformis, commonly known as the broadleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy, daisy-like blooms. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. This species is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
